original: @314a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @314a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aashtashma sha na n'a ma /
analyzed: aashtashma sha na n'a ma /
translated: Aṣṭaśmaśāna-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:🔽The Eight Charnel Grounds

original: dur khrod brgyad ces bya ba dpal he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dur khrod brgyad ces bya ba dpal he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Heruka.

original: he ru ka dpal dpa' bo ni //
analyzed: he ru ka dpal dpa' bo ni //
translated: The hero of glorious Heruka🔽bestows the fruit of enjoyment, beauty,

original: lhan cig skyes dga' mdzes pa dang // bza' dang grol ba'i 'bras rab stsol ;
analyzed: lhan cig skyes dga' mdzes pa dang // bza' dang grol ba'i 'bras rab stsol ;
translated: eating, and liberation.

original: / bla ma'i zhabs pad phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: / bla ma'i zhabs pad phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Having prostrated to the lotus feet of the guru,🔽the charnel grounds, trees, direction protectors,

original: dur khrod shing dang phyogs skyong dang // klu ba dag chu 'dor rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: dur khrod shing dang phyogs skyong dang // klu ba dag chu 'dor rnams kyi ni //
translated: and the nāgas, I will write

original: ming dang phyogs dbye gnas pa ni //
analyzed: ming dang phyogs dbye gnas pa ni //
translated: the names, directions, and locations

original: bdag nyid dran phyir bri bar bya //🔽g-yon gyi shar sogs phyogs rnams su //
analyzed: bdag nyid dran phyir bri bar bya // g-yon gyi shar sogs phyogs rnams su //
translated: for the sake of my own memory.🔽In the directions beginning with the east, to the left,

original: g-yas kyi dbang ldan phyogs rnams la //
analyzed: g-yas kyi dbang ldan phyogs rnams la //
translated: and in the directions beginning with the northeast, to the right,

original: rdo rje gur gyi nang du ni //
analyzed: rdo rje gur gyi nang du ni //
translated: within the vajra tent,

original: bzhi bzhir sbyor bar bya ba nyid //
analyzed: bzhi bzhir sbyor bar bya ba nyid //
translated: there are four sets of four.

original: gtum mchog ga ha ra nyid dang // 'bar ba 'khyim pa thod pa can //🔽rnam 'jigs shar la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: gtum mchog ga ha ra nyid dang // 'bar ba 'khyim pa thod pa can // rnam 'jigs shar la sogs pa yi //
translated: Caṇḍogra, Ghaṇṭā, Jvālamukha, and Kapālasphoṭa

original: phyogs su g-yon gyis yang dag gnas //
analyzed: phyogs su g-yon gyis yang dag gnas //
translated: are located to the left in the east and so forth.

original: aatta ha sa dbang ldan du //
analyzed: aatta ha sa dbang ldan du //
translated: Attahāsa in the northeast,🔽Pūtanā in the southeast,

original: byin za ru ni lakshi can //🔽'jig pa'i mun pa bden bral du //🔽rlung du k'i li k'i la'i sgras //
analyzed: byin za ru ni lakshi can // 'jig pa'i mun pa bden bral du // rlung du k'i li k'i la'i sgras //
translated: Rākṣasī in the southwest,🔽and in the northwest, the sound of Kilikili.

original: ro langs 'byung po'i tshogs kyis dang // ce sbyang sgra yi 'jigs pa yis //
analyzed: ro langs 'byung po'i tshogs kyis dang // ce sbyang sgra yi 'jigs pa yis //
translated: The sound of jackals and the fear of zombies and hordes of bhūtas

original: rdo rje gur gyi nang du ni //
analyzed: rdo rje gur gyi nang du ni //
translated: in the interior of the Vajra Tent,

original: dur khrod rnams ni 'jigs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: dur khrod rnams ni 'jigs pa'i gzugs //
translated: the charnel grounds with terrifying forms.

original: 'di nyid kyi ni rim pa 'dir ;
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi ni rim pa 'dir ;
translated: In this very place, in this sequence,

original: / dur khrod brgyad po rnams ni gnas //
analyzed: / dur khrod brgyad po rnams ni gnas //
translated: the eight charnel grounds are located.

original: shing dang / phyogs skyong dang / klu'i dbang po dang / char sprin gyi dbang po de rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: shing dang / phyogs skyong dang / klu'i dbang po dang / char sprin gyi dbang po de rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the trees, the lords of the directions, the lords of the nāgas, and the lords of the rain clouds?

original: shi ra sha dang aa shvadtha //
analyzed: shi ra sha dang aa shvadtha //
translated: Śiśa and Aśvattha,

original: kam kelle shing tsu ta nyid //🔽gong mtshungs ba ta ka ranydza //
analyzed: kam kelle shing tsu ta nyid // gong mtshungs ba ta ka ranydza //
translated: Kamkī, the tree Cūta,🔽and the same above, Vata and Karṇaja.

original: dbang po dang ni nor sbyin nyid //
analyzed: dbang po dang ni nor sbyin nyid //
translated: Indra and Kubera,🔽then the lord of the nāgas, then the lord of Yama,

original: klu dbang de nas gshin rje bdag / dbang ldan de nas byin za bdag / srin po'i dbang po rlung bdag nyid //
analyzed: klu dbang de nas gshin rje bdag / dbang ldan de nas byin za bdag / srin po'i dbang po rlung bdag nyid //
translated: the lord of the Rākṣasas, the lord of Vāyu,🔽Vāsuki and Takṣaka,

original: nor rgyas bu dang 'jog de nyid //
analyzed: nor rgyas bu dang 'jog de nyid //
translated: and the same above.

original: stobs kyi rgyu dang padma nyid //
analyzed: stobs kyi rgyu dang padma nyid //
translated: The cause of strength and Padma himself,🔽Padma-great, Hula-hula,

original: pad chen hu lu hu lu dang // rigs ldan dang ni dung skyong ngo //
analyzed: pad chen hu lu hu lu dang // rigs ldan dang ni dung skyong ngo //
translated: Kulaka, and Dundubhi,🔽Garjita, Ghurmita, and Bhima,

original: gardzi ghurmi to 'jigs dang // aa pa to dang gha na nyid //
analyzed: gardzi ghurmi to 'jigs dang // aa pa to dang gha na nyid //
translated: Apata, and Gana itself,

original: barsha na dang bu ra na //
analyzed: barsha na dang bu ra na //
translated: Varsana, and Varuna,🔽these are the fierce cloud lords.

original: gtum @314b pa 'di rnams char sprin bdag / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ratna shr'i mi tra dang / dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis bsgyur ba//
analyzed: gtum @314b pa 'di rnams char sprin bdag / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ratna shr'i mi tra dang / dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis bsgyur ba//
translated: By the Indian abbot Ratnashirimitra and the monk Shakyasiddhi.
